reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Mila doesn't want to go to Enchor's Heart.
reviews.reviewText: Destiny awaits Mila and Krena if only they can escape. They didn't expect to find love but when they did it would take everything for them to be together. It's a sweet story filled with hot and steamy romance and action intrigue, and adventure while they try to hide they're feelings for each other and escape to be together for ever. I really enjoyed reading it. Bravo!.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What can I say!?!? But classic Tammy style.Krena comes off the page with confidence and ownership although he is in a very very precarious situation. Mila at first gives off the impression of being a spoiled child but as time went on you realize that Mila just wanted to live a life she understood and her parent had prepared her for. I was intrigued that the Govenor could see the the attraction or the looks between Krena & Mila but the Govenor was caught up in his own second chance at love.I would have liked to find out why her parents sent her to her uncle, Sleii, and not the known family in France. Hopefully it will be explained later in the series.Looking forward to more!.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: An amazing story. Milas parents left her in the custody of her uncle who lived on Enchors Heart, a far away moon that is just starting to be colonized. When Mila is told that, she plans to escape and go to her aunts in France. But on the way to Enchors Heart, she meets Krena, who is going there to be the Governors assistant. On the journey they fall in love, but the moment they reach Enchors Heart, she finds out that her uncle has arranged her marraige to the governor. Will Mila and Krena be able to run away and be together? Loved reading their story. Thanx.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was a good alien story. Krena and Mila's story was a good quick read and leads into the next one that I'm excited to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I fell in love on a starship
reviews.reviewText: Betrothed to the Alien By Tammy Walsh is book one of Fated Mates of Enchor’s Heart. Mila is a 22-year-old woman, recently orphaned. Mila always dreamed of living in France since she was a little girl. It was a shock when, in her parents' will, Mila learned she would not be going to live with her aunts in France but with her estranged uncle Sleii on a planet called Enchor’s Heart. Her plot devised a way to run away as soon as possible, which required an accomplice, Aria. Aria had become Mila’s best friend in the orphanage. Aria is an orphan, and the two bonded unexpectedly, becoming each other's chosen family as sisters. While Mila was busy making plans, she fell in love with a dashing young chi named Krena on the starliner headed for Enchor’s Heart. The obstacle was that Mila’s uncle had betrothed her to the governor of Enchor’s Heart, Krena’s boss! This tale switches perspectives between the two lovers as they struggle to find a way out of the impending engagement so they can live happily ever after. HEA ending these fated mates does not fail to captivate the heart with young love. I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Mila (h), thrust into an arranged marriage, finds herself in a heart-wrenching predicament as she's betrothed to an older Governor while secretly in love with Krena (H), her uncle's right-hand man. The tension spikes as Mila and Krena plot their escape, navigating deception and danger to secure their freedom and love. At first glance, Mila's character appears self-centered, but glimpses of her true heart surface, especially in her care for Aria, her chaperone. Krena evolves into a steadfast partner in their daring plan. Their bond and determination shine through despite initial misgivings. Hot and steamy alien-human romance with plenty of passion and danger as Mila and Krena seek their escape and quest for a happy ending.Each "Fated Mates of Enchor's Heart" book follows different characters within the universe of Enchor's Heart, exploring their unique challenges, relationships, and romances against a backdrop of alien cultures, secrets, and unexpected connections. The series intertwines their stories while offering standalone romances in each book:Betrothed to the Alien: Krena & MilaPromised to the Alien: Sleii & AriaSworn to the Alien: Icor & LaylaEnthralled to the Alien: Ruara & AnnaSubjected Pledged to the Alien: Fika & NoraPledged to the Alien: Rurdrax/Lorik & Madison

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Betrothed to the Alien
reviews.reviewText: MILA is a young woman who is orphaned and sent to an orphanage until her her parents will can be read. There she meets Aria who she befriends. When she's told she will be sent to be with her Uncle Sleii on Enchor's Heart. She is not happy because the family feels he if not literally killed his wife, her aunt, then he nudged her into it. On the way there she meets a young Chi male, Krena, and they embark on a romantic affair. But once she arrives at her uncle's she discovers that she is engaged to the Governor, the male who her beloved works for. Things are not good and getting worse. Mila plots with Aria on how to see her love and then how to escape. Krena is willing to fight for his love. Will it come to a fight? Will the two lovers be able to escape to follow their own dreams and love?Another fantastic story set on this planet.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Book 2 helps fill in the story of Book 1
reviews.reviewText: My favorite character was Aria, who thankfully is the center of Book 2 which I’m currently reading. I found her to be an interesting and intelligent character.I especially liked the action and suspense that was included in this story, but it felt like the reckless actions of Mila distracted from their impact. However, the dramatic action scene near the end of the book was very well done.I enjoyed this book enough to start book 2 almost right after and was thrilled to discover that Book 2 fills in a lot of unanswered questions that I had from this story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great start to a new series. She finds out she is betrothed to the governor but has feelings for his assistant. Love is never easy
